Reviews.Title: Well priced computer Laptop that truly is funtional.
Reviews.Author: Sharon
Reviews.Content: I like the quick charge and this computer keeps the charge.  I stays cool. Which is great and does not have a loud cooling system.  The weight is okay but could be lighter in weight. I like the sleekness and the color.  Windows 8 is okay.  Windows 8 is tricky but okay.  Windows 8 does not have a DVD maker which is a true pain if you are a person that has that need. Over all would definitely recommend this computer.

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop  SSD even better!!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop for my son and we both decided against windows 8 as an OS. We had a really tough time installing Windows 7 and there is not much help from ASUS on the configuration to use in the UEFI (new bios). We found that disabling most of the secure boot features and not booting from a UEFI device seemed to work. I runs really fast and has a really good battery life and a neat sleep mode widget from ASUS.  We then installed a 256GB SSD drive and this thing is like lightening!!!  I would consider this a great unit but we did find it for $40 less after we made the purchase, so shop around !

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Keri L. Bolach "Krobles2012"
Reviews.Content: Love it. Great for sims and every day use. Windows 8 isn't that bad As long as you have an open mind. It's quick and a great computer! Has a lot if nice features like the cool rest by the keyboard for your hands. Love how the charger clips in too! It's not flimsy like a lot of computers. Not being a techy I want to turn it on and have it work.. It does just that!

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: Rosario
Reviews.Content: I got this laptop as a gift  for my daughter graduation, she loves it so much its fast and good quality I don't see any problem.we hope we don't have any,so far is nice ,Thank you

Reviews.Title: Good price for a good computer
Reviews.Author: John Vorwald
Reviews.Content: Been using this computer for about a year.  It works great for surfing the web, writing documents, writing emails, writing computer software, and watching movies.

Reviews.Title: Coolest comp
Reviews.Author: NIKOYA
Reviews.Content: I was told that Asus, although an underdog to the typical, HP, Dell and Apple, was a good buy and worthy computer brand. It has been right. I love my Asus, and I love the way it works. The windows 8 is different as far as navigation, but I like it. The computer works wonderfully. More than enough power to hold my programs. I use power point, word, excel, photoshop, and AutoCAD and this computer doesn't miss a beat! I still can upload or download items in a reasonable amount of time with no problem. The color and design is nice too. I get a lot of compliments on it. If you're questioning, don't. It's worth it. Trust me.

Reviews.Title: Good laptop for the price!
Reviews.Author: Brett Kerigan
Reviews.Content: For the price, this laptop packs some power behind a decent screen.Although you may feel inadequate around the retina display laptops around you in class, you paid about half what they paid for a laptop with more power (depending on what they have).I've played many games on the laptop and I don't experience much lag on decent settings. The laptop doesn't head up too much, either. It is all around pretty good.For school, it performs pretty well, but I will say the keyboard is just average. It doesn't feel as nice as all the other laptops you will mess with, but like I said earlier... the power to price ratio is amazing.If the keyboard felt a little stronger and had better feedback, I would give this laptop 5 stars.I have had no problems with this laptop and do not regret purchasing it for a second.

Reviews.Title: It's okay
Reviews.Author: Don Boudreau "road dog"
Reviews.Content: No real problems here.  Not a big fan of Windows 8.  Wished I had watched for other options like firewire ports and PCI express card slots.  Can't complain though; fair price and its working well.  If you don't have needs for firewire and PCI this has some nice other features like Card Reader and HDMI connections.

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money
Reviews.Author: Bruce E. Reynolds "Excel Expert"
Reviews.Content: The only thing I don't like about this laptop is the keyboard is a little unpredictable. I went ahead and got a Logitech bluetooth keyboard to use for this laptop if I have to do a lot of accurate typing (whether a Word document, or and Excel spreadsheet). There are some keys on the keyboard that don't take. I don't know whether you have to break the keyboard in like a pair of shoes, but to be safe, the bluetooth keyboard does come in handy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Farley "maffetina"
Reviews.Content: I've been using the K55A for a solid nine months or so, and it's an outstanding computer. I use Norton Antivirus and Crashplan as backup, and it's been smooth sailing all year (knock wood! :)).The only glitchy thing I experience is sometimes the touchpad gets overly sensitive, which will make the cursor jump around on the screen, and I've no idea why this happens. It's a problem that comes and goes, but considering how robust the features are in this model, I'm not going to dock it a star.The cover on the unit is perhaps a little softer than I would like, but again, what you pay for with ASUS are the features. As I use this laptop really as a desktop, this hasn't been a big deal either. I'm considering the ASUS T-100 notebook as a portable option to take around with me, although I've taken the ASUS K55A on trips and it's been fine. It's simply a little heavier than I would like, but that's what you get with such a feature-rich machine!One feature I LOVE is that this thing never gets hot! My old laptop got so hot on the bottom that I had to buy a special cushion for it. I always had the fear that it was going to explode in my lap! But the ASUS remains cool no matter how long I have it on.I've been reading lately that ASUS's customer service has been slipping, but I wouldn't know as I haven't needed it with this fantastic model.

Reviews.Title: Black screen all the time; cursor jumps around
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Richmeier
Reviews.Content: I rarely write reviews but this laptop as been a huge disappointment. My main problem is that the screen blacks out. Moving the mouse and attempting to restart the laptop don't work. I have to remove the battery for a few minutes and then restart. It's very inconvenient when you're using it for recipes online and you can't proceed because you're waiting on the battery and restart. I have to do this at least once a week. I also find it weird that the cursor jumps around. I'll be typing and all of the sudden the cursor has moved to another location in the text. I would return this item if I could but I've missed the return window.

Reviews.Title: Great Hardware
Reviews.Author: Russley Shaw
Reviews.Content: I use Linux and bought this computer with the intentions of removing Windows. The hardware works with most distributions right out of the box. The CPU is fast and the HDD is large enough (750gigs). My only complaints are initially installing Linux was a pain (EFI secure boot) and the AC adapter wire feels thin. Otherwise this computer makes a great work/development machine with enough speed to still make it fun to use.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop, says the man who's owned no other
Reviews.Author: John Webb
Reviews.Content: Mine has worked very well.  Start up is really fast, and waking it up is only delayed by putting in my password.  Functions very well.  I miss the Paint Shop Pro that came with my Dell, but I think that's because I didn't want to spend the money for it.  The speakers seem to be on the bottom of the machine, so if it's on your lap or any not-hard, flat surface, it's hard to hear.  Battery has a good life, warns you a few times before saving its state and shutting down.  No complaints.

Reviews.Title: Love the computer, hate Windows 8
Reviews.Author: Adam
Reviews.Content: The computer is terrific.Especially love the quick on and off.Hate the new Windows interface.I cannot imagine why tiles are helpful.I would take this device with Windows XP any day.

Reviews.Title: Good computer
Reviews.Author: Magnus Wu
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed having this computer. Had a few hiccups early on with random resets and shut-downs. Was going to send it back to ASUS under my warranty since I've had it for less than a week and they adamantly keep saying how additional fees will be likely. Great... so the inconvenience of sending it back for a few weeks plus additional fees for their mistakes. Oh well, live and learn.Overall, computer runs pretty well. Windows 8 is very incompatible with iTunes and CD burns. Computer is heavier than most but it seemed from past ratings that it lasts longer. I'm hoping for that. Customer service for ASUS was a massive turn-off unfortunately, especially in comparison to Dell customer service.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop when you're on a budget
Reviews.Author: Bill Seward
Reviews.Content: Appealing design, good performance, reasonable build quality for the price point.  Not too much crapware to uninstall.  At these specs you could buy it for a high school graduate and expect it to make it through 4 years of college.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "WesWare Online"
Reviews.Content: Responsive, great display, and built solid. Trackpad could be positioned a little more to the left to avoid accidental swipes with my right thumb but i've adjusted. The keyboard could be a bit less flat too but again, i've adjusted. Other than the annoying quirks of Windows 8, it's a great laptop. Windows 8 takes some getting used to for sure..

Reviews.Title: No Touch!
Reviews.Author: Skrag
Reviews.Content: Did not catch on that this does not have a touch screen.  Since my son was not expecting one, and has not gotten used to Win 8 with touch, he is perfectly happy.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Good job ASUS! This machine is nice, silent, and does not feel as hot as other laptops plus it looks very high end and it was cheap.In the other hand it will be perfect with windows 7, but not everything is as we like and this one comes with Windows 8(not good). To me that will work better with a  touch screen not with a standard laptop screen. But overall I'm happy with this laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great product, great price, great Seller
Reviews.Author: chuck ashlin
Reviews.Content: My son bought an Asus a couple of years ago. I was so impressed with his, I decided, since my old HP was getting ready to die, to order and try this model Asus laptop. I'm pretty computer literate and I cant tell you how happy I am with this laptop. The Seller was great to work with and charged such a great price. Its fast...I mean fast. 6 gigs of ram and a I5 processor, a 750 gig hard drive, wow! I've read other computer suave people say the display was on the weak side on Asus laptop's but I have to disagree. This Asus K55A-DS51 has a true HD display and the included software for music, pictures and watching video and movies is excellent. I mean, I paid way more 6 years ago for another brand, which shall remain nameless, and it couldn't touch this one in any area. In closing, besides outstanding performance and battery life, its really a sharp looking laptop. I got the matching Mocha mouse and my family and friends want the exact model and mouse. I don't see how the Seller is making a profit selling this so cheap, but I'm so glad he/she is! As more and more people order Asus's, I'm sure the price for such a quality machine is going to rise. If you're looking for a good priced, good performance laptop, this is it .Oh , so glad Asus doesn't "brand" the heck out of their products, and the warranty is outstanding even against user mishaps...i.e. spilling things on, dropping etc., Outstanding!ASUS K55A-DS51

Reviews.Title: great notebook
Reviews.Author: L. Sandling "EbookBecauseIcan"
Reviews.Content: Light weight with lots of features.  Great value for your money.  Better than I expected!  Well worth your time to research when looking for a new notebook.

Reviews.Title: Great solid Laptop @ a great price
Reviews.Author: FuDogDad
Reviews.Content: The performance of this laptop is fantastic. No issues whatsoever. Since ASUS has been around for more than 20 years manufacturing and providing hardware for big names such as Apple, I thought that I'd be getting a solid laptop and was 100% correct. I upgraded from a Toshiba Satellite. This laptop is solid and feels well built. Especially compared to the Toshiba, which felt flimsy. It's fast and quite responsive. Watching movies is great. The screen is crisp. Windows 8 takes a little getting used to.

Reviews.Title: fast and functional
Reviews.Author: Angelika Carroll
Reviews.Content: I give this computer 5 stars because it is super-fast and solidly designed.  I was a little disappointed that it does not come with MS office, but I overlooked that in the description.  Also Windws 8 is a bit obtuse to work with, but once you figure out its quirks you get used to it. Having said all that, I am still very impressed with the machine.  It is everything the techies at work told me it would be.

Reviews.Title: Format to 7 and you'll be fine
Reviews.Author: S. R. Bryan "srbryan"
Reviews.Content: As with ANY computer ordered these days the bloatware is extremely tedious to work around without 1000 pop ups. We immediately formatted to Windows 7 Professional and it runs like a champ!We mainly use this for Microsoft Office Softwares and normal day to day internet use. No games have been tested on this hardware.PS Most ASUS hardware that you will order does not have drivers for windows 7, thankfully this one did because Windows 8 SUCKS~!

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: CodyArtillery
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous buying this at first, however as soon as I booted it up, I loved it. Besides windows 8, this is a very good computer. Doesn't over heat, i5 brings the power, and very smooth textures. Capable of gaming (WoW, Defiance, CoD, etc) I'd definitely recommend it, especially if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with ASUS
Reviews.Author: L. G. E.
Reviews.Content: To be honest I was a little nervous about buy ASUS but so far it has been great. I am happy with my choice and I researched for a long time. I tend to over research things, especially electronics. I don't like the finger pad but that applies to all laptops; I need to get a notebook mouse.

Reviews.Title: Fast!
Reviews.Author: Cole Ruffalo "DJ"
Reviews.Content: This laptop is super fast! Definitely an improvement over my last laptop. The only problem I have with this laptop (that I'm learning to live with) is that the mouse buttons are also part of the trackpad, so when you glide over them with your fingers, the mouse pointer moves as it would on the actual trackpad. This can get quite annoying and definitely interferes with precision. If there's a way to turn it off, I haven't found it yet, but besides the occasional Windows 8 headache, this is a powerful laptop for the price!

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Douglas Maher "Doug"
Reviews.Content: Love using it...my only issue is the speaker is on the bottom in the front and it really is a pain to try and hear things unless you are sitting on a table. I recommend this laptop if you are in the market for one.

Reviews.Title: Great computer and priced right
Reviews.Author: G. Reger
Reviews.Content: Bought this computer for may cousin who is just graduating from high school and getting ready for college. He loved this laptop.

Reviews.Title: great computet
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I had it a couple weeks and love it. I just don't like mcafee virus protection. Other than that it's a great computer
